page.title: 06WEST PENNARD PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The primary school is situated next to the church and was built in 1853.In 1967 it became an area school taking children from a number of villages including Pilton, West Bradley, North Wootton and East Pennard. At that time it was enlarged with a new hall, kitchen and mobile classrooms. Today the school has 183 children aged 4 to 11. Some come over 5km to school each day and are transported by a local coach and mini-bus firm. The school feeds four secondary schools in Shepton Mallet,Glastonbury, Wells and Ansford with new pupils. The staff comprises six teachers, the head and twelve ancilliary staff. The facilities include a covered swimming pool, playing field, adventure playground and a range of computers and videos.
